text: my name is simon braxtman i work in
phillips corporate sustainability
department
and i've been involved with
sustainability for the last couple of
years
my thoughts on integrated reporting you
should be aware that philips has been
delivering integrated reports for the
past two years and the
annual report 2010 will be our third
integrated annual report
um we would not be doing this if we
didn't believe in it and we think
integrated reporting is equivalent for
better reporting
why do i say that because basically
in the integrated reports
we
spend more attention
on the risk and reputation management of
the the company as well as the
sustainable business opportunities of
the company
and i think if if we do that
in the right way and none of us would be
doing the same
we would be having a more comprehensive
view of the companies that people want
to review
personally i've come from a financial
background
and
in the financial world people have been
delivering reports for
ages i would say
if you start reporting
on sustainability as well you come to a
diverse group of people who've got to
deliver information to you and the
discipline in that group of people is a
little bit different from the discipline
in the financial world which also means
that if the moment you start reporting
in an integrated way timelines are set
by the one who is fastest not the one
who is the latest in delivering data so
that poses an immediate challenge to you
in order to run in tandem with the ones
who deliver the financial reports and
the financial numbers meaning that
this is all about process improvement
and you know
by the token quite a challenging process
in a big company like we have in phyllis
but it's doable but it takes some time
to to achieve that status we publish our
financial report or you know the
integrated financial social and
environmental report uh the uh about the
seventh week at the end of the seventh
week of every year which is we're one of
the we're the second fastest in the
netherlands and one of the the first
ones also in the global basis
that means that we've got our process in
order but
you know this is also for us a
continuous improvement process so the
moment we have delivered our annual
report
we start measuring the response we look
at the you know what are the most
popular pages that people go to is it
easy to find you know all kind of other
aspects that that are relevant for
further process improvement and we're
working on that so the lessons learned
in 2009 we tried to incorporate in the
annual report 2010 which we're
developing at this moment already
because if i look at the number of
people who visit our
annual report web website
those numbers are
increasing tremendously if we compare
2009 to 2008 we've got a uh almost 50 to
60 increase in visitors and also the
time people spend on the website is
increasing significantly so that means
we probably have some interesting
content there and what we try to do is
uh also look at what is the most
appealing content
to the visitors and make that easier to
find in the 2010 annual report you know
during the uh the two days seminar here
we we saw the the case of southwestern
who did go for deep dive you know you
never get it right the first time but i
would rather
plea to just get started and start the
integrated reporting you will um you
know there are quite some lessons you
can learn from other companies so try to
incorporate that already the first time
you have a go around
and try to also
you know
get sufficient support from your senior
management of course because if they
don't believe in doing this you know
sustainability is not high on the agenda
of senior management and you can write a
very nice story about it but it's not
supported by the company so senior
support is is definitely one of the
preconditions
but also try to engage with your
stakeholders try to see what is relevant
to them what's relevant to the industry
and try to address all those topics in
your integrated report in a nice way and
then try to get your learnings try to
get feedback from all kinds of
stakeholders after you launch your
integrated report
and try to continue to improve but we
found it very worthwhile so
and then very interesting and
challenging journey to be to be part of
